2.text: Use a rubber band to separate the affected hair.
2.vid: /8/8b/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Apply peanut butter using a toothbrush.
3.vid: /8/81/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Use a towel to clean your hair.
4.vid: /b/b7/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 4.360p.mp4

5.vid: /8/82/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 5.360p.mp4

6.text: Use a rubber band to separate the affected hair.
6.vid: /7/7e/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 6.360p.mp4

7.vid: /6/6d/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 7.360p.mp4

8.vid: /7/79/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 8.360p.mp4

9.vid: /3/3e/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 9.360p.mp4

10.vid: /7/74/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 10.360p.mp4

11.text: Apply dissolvers directly and let them sit for at least a minute.
11.vid: /5/5b/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 11.360p.mp4

12.text: Clean the residue out of your hair.
12.vid: /0/0e/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 12.360p.mp4

13.vid: /f/fb/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 13.360p.mp4

14.text: Use an ice wrap to harden the gum.
14.vid: /0/0a/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 14.360p.mp4

15.text: Chip the hardened gum out of your hair.
15.vid: /9/9b/Get Gum Out of Your Hair Step 15.360p.mp4
